org.schwering.evi.core
Interface IModuleListener

All Known Implementing Classes:
TabBar
public interface IModuleListener

Listens to instantiation/disposal of a module. Each listener is connected with exactly one ModuleContainer. The events instantiated and disposed are fired when the respective methods in ModuleFactory are invoked.

Author:
Christoph Schwering (mailto:schwering@gmail.com)
See Also:
ModuleContainer.addListener(IModuleListener), ModuleFactory.newInstance(ModuleContainer, IParent), ModuleFactory.newInstance(ModuleContainer, IParent, Object[]), ModuleFactory.disposeInstance(IModule)

Method Summary
 void disposed(IModule disposedInstance)
          Fired when a module is disposed via ModuleFactory.disposeInstance(IModule).
 void instantiated(IModule newInstance)
          Fired when a module is instantiated via ModuleFactory.newInstance(ModuleContainer, IParent).
 

Method Detail

instantiated

public void instantiated(IModule newInstance)
Fired when a module is instantiated via ModuleFactory.newInstance(ModuleContainer, IParent).
When a module is instantiated, the following things happen in this order:
  1. The instance object is created.
  2. The instance is registrated at its ModuleContainer and thus accessible via ModuleContainer.getInstances().
  3. This event is fired.

Parameters:
newInstance - The newly created instance of the module.
See Also:
ModuleFactory.newInstance(ModuleContainer, IParent), ModuleFactory.newInstance(ModuleContainer, IParent, Object[])

disposed

public void disposed(IModule disposedInstance)
Fired when a module is disposed via ModuleFactory.disposeInstance(IModule).
When a module is disposed, the following things happen in this order:
  1. This event is fired.
  2. The instance is unregistrated at its ModuleContainer and no longer returned by ModuleContainer.getInstances().
  3. The instance object's IModule.dispose() is invoked.

Parameters:
disposedInstance - The instance which is disposed.
See Also:
ModuleFactory.disposeInstance(IModule)
